meanings.definition: A poster or program listing the cast and other details of a theatrical performance.
meanings.sent1: The playbill displayed the names of the actors and the show's schedule.
meanings.sent2: I always collect the playbill after watching a play to remember the performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tore up the playbill, thinking it was a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a vibrant playbill on a dark night.
meanings.sent5: The playbill, with its colorful design, stood out among the other posters.

meanings.definition: To advertise or promote a theatrical performance through the distribution of playbills.
meanings.sent1: The theater company will playbill the upcoming show in the city center.
meanings.sent2: They playbill every new production to attract a larger audience.
meanings.sent3: The actors playbill their show with enthusiasm, hoping for a full house.
meanings.sent4: She playbills the play like a skilled marketer, ensuring a sold-out performance.
meanings.sent5: The director playbills the play with creativity, drawing in curious viewers.
